SEARCH
Package de.qwikbyte.datacore.orm

Class SchemaSynchronizer

java.lang.Object
de.qwikbyte.datacore.orm.SchemaSynchronizer
public class SchemaSynchronizer extends Object
The SchemaSynchronizer class is responsible for ensuring that the database schema is synchronized with the structure of annotated Java entity classes. It provides functionality for creating tables and adding columns to match the fields in the entity classes. This class works with entity classes annotated with @Entity, and their fields must be annotated with @Column. It uses database metadata to check existing table and column definitions, and it creates or updates database schemas as necessary. The synchronization process includes: - Checking the presence of an @Entity annotation to identify the corresponding database table. - Gathering fields annotated with @Column, determining their properties, and mapping them to SQL types. - Creating new tables if they do not exist. - Adding missing columns to an existing table. Dependencies: - DatabaseManager: A helper class responsible for managing database connections. - Annotations: @Entity, @Column, @GeneratedValue.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • syncEntity

      public void syncEntity(Class<?> entityClass) throws SQLException
      Synchronizes the database schema for a given entity class by ensuring that its corresponding database table and columns are properly created or updated according to the annotations defined in the class. If the specified entity class is annotated with @Entity, the method performs the following actions: - Retrieves the table name specified in the @Entity annotation. - Checks existing columns in the table based on metadata from the database. - Compares the annotated fields in the class with the existing columns. - Creates the table if it does not exist. - Adds missing columns to the table. If the entity class is not annotated with @Entity, the method exits without performing any actions. The method uses field-level annotations like @Column to determine the column properties (e.g., name, nullable, primary key). Additionally, it uses @GeneratedValue to identify fields with generated values and their corresponding generation strategies. Throws SQLException if any database error occurs during schema synchronization.
      Parameters:
      entityClass - the class representing the entity for which the database schema needs to be synchronized. This class must be annotated with @Entity. Fields annotated with @Column are treated as database columns.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error while creating or altering the database schema.
